You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Add Widgets to Storefront Pages with Visualforce Components

Enhance the functionality of your storefront pages by enabling and configuring widgets, such as Quick Order, Mini Cart, Search Box, and more.

REQUIRED EDITIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)
Manage the Storefront Header
Provide a trusted storefront experience that follows conventional website design and provides options for buyers to quickly access their account information from any page.
Show the Breadcrumb Widget
Provide more context for a buyer when they view a list of products or view a particular product's details. When you enable the Breadcrumb widget, you can show the path through the storefront's category taxonomy on the Product List page or Product Detail page. Or, you can indicate that the list of products on the Product List page is the result of a search instead of a selected category.
Show the Category Tree Widget
Support buyers who prefer to click through a natural taxonomy of categories when discovering products. When you enable the Category Tree widget for your storefront, a buyer can quickly see all your categories and subcategories. Selecting a category shows all the products that you've assigned to that category and that the buyer is entitled to view.
Show the Effective Account Selector
Support buyers who can browse and purchase on behalf of accounts other than their own. When you enable effective accounts, provide an intuitive user experience directly on the storefront for a buyer to easily switch between accounts. Selecting a different account shows that account's entitled products, entitled prices, and other account information.
Show the Feature Filtering Widget
Support buyers who prefer to apply filters for specific physical or operational criteria when discovering products. When you enable the Feature Filtering widget, a buyer can refine the results on the Product List page by selecting particular spec values. Applying a filter shows only the products that have that spec value assigned and that the buyer is entitled to view.
Show the Locale Switcher Widget
Support buyers who purchase for multiple languages and geographic regions. When you enable the Locale Switcher widget, a buyer can easily swap between supported locales from the header on your storefront. Selecting a new locale shows localized storefront content and currencies, if available.
Show the Mini Cart Widget
Provide an efficient shopping experience for buyers by requiring fewer clicks to complete their purchase workflow. When you enable the Mini Cart widget, a buyer can quickly review their cart items and update quantities without navigating to the Shopping Cart page.
Show the Quick Order Widget
Support your storefront's experienced buyers who already know exactly which SKUs and the appropriate quantities they want to purchase. When you enable the Quick Order widget, a buyer can quickly add items to their cart without having to browse and discover products.
Show the Reorder Widget
Give buyers a shortcut for quickly placing a new order based on a previous order. When you enable the Reorder widget for your storefront, a buyer can see up to three of their most recent orders at a glance. With a single click, the buyer can start a new shopping cart based on one of those recent orders.
Show the Search Box Widget
Support buyers who prefer to search by keyword when discovering products. When you enable the Search Box widget, a buyer can search by text on a product record, the product's spec values, or custom product tabs. Products that match the search string display on the Product List page.
Show the Splash Widget
Capture your buyers' attention with a series of large, prominently displayed images that can link to particular products, categories, or URLs. When you enable the Splash widget, promotions that you've enabled for the Splash location type automatically cycle through in a carousel or slideshow.
Show Spotlight Products and Featured Products
Prominently showcase certain products on your Home page. For example, maybe you have certain products that are popular and you want to encourage more sales. You can display those products immediately when buyers reach your storefront.
Considerations for Autocomplete Suggestions in Search Box and Quick Order Widgets
To help buyers find products in the Search Box or Quick Order widget more efficiently, you can provide autocomplete matches for a partial search string.

title: Enhancing Visualforce B2B Commerce with Custom Widgets
